body:
Unfortunately, it looks like there wasn't enough interest from the team
or community to implement this change. While we wish we'd be able to
accommodate everyone's requests, we do need to prioritize. We've found
that issues failing to reach accepted status after 21 days tend to
never be accepted, and as such, we [close those issues](https://eslint.org/docs/maintainer-guide/issues#when-to-close-an-issue).
This doesn't mean the idea isn't interesting or useful, just that it's
not something the team can commit to.

Thanks for contributing to ESLint and we appreciate your understanding.

[//]: # (auto-close)

issue.title: feat: ðŸŽ¸ add ramda and test-tools import messages

repository.name: typescript
repository.description: VTEX's TypeScript tools, style guide and best practices

issue.body:
#### What is the purpose of this pull request?

Add recommendation messages for restricted imports (`@testing-library/react` and `lodash`).

#### Screenshots or example usage

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12702016/73574081-91f5c980-4453-11ea-89b3-b04ff9c1b20b.png)

Unfortunately, currently eslint doesn't support adding messages to a `pattern` restriction, so `lodash/*` is not as nice as it could be. There's an open issue about this [here](https://github.com/eslint/eslint/issues/11843). We could probably help implement this, seems easy enough. Do we wait for that?

Closes #13

#### Types of changes

- [ ] Bug fix (a non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
- [x] New feature (a non-breaking change which adds functionality)
- [ ] Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to change)
- [ ] Requires change to documentation, which has been updated accordingly.

body: Been smashing my head against a wall trying to find a way to do this. +1 interest

Folks, no need to leave a comment to express interest. Thereâ€™s definitely enough interest. What we need now is someone to figure out if itâ€™s possible to create a rule schema to validate such options while maintaining backwards compatibility.
